title: Re: keengrid.net...
content:

title: Re: keengrid.net...
content:
Fucl... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] It was meant to be 315 x 315. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] And I think I even typed that value, I can't understand what went wrong. Oh, well... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] This creates more confusion then. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img]

I have some ideas, yeah, but as said, it will just be my new Keen site, different from the previous ones and hopefully something I get using a lot more, finally (I'm tired of paying and not using my site). We'll see... Likely I get new ideas while working on it.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: keengrid.net...
content: I say start with the Mod Maze, and focus on keeping that up to date to start with! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]  It's an important place to have, especially when DOSClassics crashes out. Maybe setup a basic admin system so a couple of other folks can help keep it running?

title: Re: keengrid.net...
content:
I will have it there too, at least in some form, but I don't honestly think many even know it exist, not to mention that anyone uses it. I won't let anyone else touch it, however, I don't need any outside help with it. I was just too garged to update the KeenGrid one with my "new" mod because I didn't want to do anything with Grid anymore. And also, as I'm going to make the new site not based on MySQL or such, but text files I'm editing on my computer, I don't want anyone else messing with the files, it'd bring only trouble.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
